data.title: Frist Art Museum
data.meta_description: The Frist Art Museum opened in April 2001 and has since hosted touring exhibitions from some of the most prestigious collections in the world, as well as award-winning shows organized in-house. Our exhibitions change every few months, so plan to visit often to see what’s new.
data.text:
Don't miss the next Frist Friday—it’s a Fashion Finale!

Join us on August 23 for the second installment of Frist Fridays 2024 celebrating the closing weekend of Lee Alexander McQueen & Ann Ray: Rendez-Vous with fashion, music, and more! Enjoy DJ sets from Raiden, Annie DiRusso & DJ r.a.k., a tour of Rendez-Vous, and a performance in ¡Printing the Revolution! Meet new friends and spark inspiring conversations with our friends at Folx Table, Nashville’s “Sit Down Social Network.”

Sign up to become a Frist volunteer!

Join our team! We are looking for people of all ages to help in Guest Services, the gift shop, and Martin ArtQuest. Volunteers enjoy FREE access to all our exhibitions, free parking, discounts in the gift shop, and more! It’s a wonderful way to meet new people and support the arts. Submit your application by September 18 to be included in the next training session on Saturday, September 21.

Watch current volunteer Jamie Celmer talk about her experience as a volunteer.

Get Creative in ArtQuest with McQueen-Inspired Stations!

Martin ArtQuest is looking super stylish with stations inspired by our Lee Alexander McQueen & Ann Ray: Rendez-Vous exhibition! We are thrilled to present twelve design sketches by McQueen to inspire guests to create looks for their own spring/summer ’24 collection. The Drawing in the Round station features our mannequin glamorously dressed in a McQ garment with a headpiece inspired by McQueen collaborator Philip Treacy’s elaborate creations. Other exhibition-focused activities include dress-up magnets, a photo framing exercise, and books about fashion and friendship.
